Pertumbuhan Ekonomi RI Lesu, BI: Ada Perang Dagang
07 Nov 2019, 03:31 by Achmad Dwi Afriyadi


Foto: Achmad Dwi Afriyadi

Jakarta - Bank Indonesia (BI) mengungkap kondisi perekonomian nasional dalam acara Workshop on Accelerating Infrastructure Development yang di gelar di Kawasan Jakarta Pusat, Kamis (7/11/2019). Acara ini dihadiri oleh perwakilan pemerintah daerah.Deputi Gubernur BI Rosmaya Hadi menjelaskan, kondisi ekonomi global saat ini tengah tidak menentu dan bakal berlanjut. Hal itu disebabkan oleh perang dagang antara Amerika Serikat (AS) dan China."Kita sama-sama tahu kondisi saat ini, kita menyadari global ada trade war yang rasanya roll dan sustain, antara Amerika dan China yang merambah Eropa, Jepang, dan seterusnya. Dan, kondisi geopolitik yg menyebabkan perekonomian berbagai negara terimbas," katanya.Rosmaya melanjutkan, data pertumbuhan ekonomi nasional pun sudah dirilis di mana pada kuartal III ekonomi Indonesia hanya tumbuh 5,02%. Hal ini menunjukkan ketidakpastian global berpengaruh pada kinerja perdagangan.Memang, Rosmaya melihat ada perkembangan di sisi ekspor karena didorong kenaikan harga nikel. Menurutnya, itu hanya bersifat sementara."Kita sama-sama tahu ekspor triwulan III ada perkembangannya adanya ekspor nikel, itu secara khusus kita lihat harga nikel kita lihat ada meningkat, ini bukan karena kebutuhan riil. Saya rasa ini antisipasi pelarangan ekspor. Kita harus waspadai itu," ungkapnya.Hal yang menantang lainnya ialah kinerja manufaktur yang melemah di tengah transformasi yang sedang dilakukan pemerintah. Dia bilang ini harus menjadi perhatian karena berdampak pada investasi dan konsumsi."Kita lihat juga lemahnya kinerja sektor manufaktur di tengah sejumlah transformasi pemerintah dan akan menjadi perhatian kita karena dampaknya investasi dan konsumsi," paparnya.Simak Video "Kominfo Siapkan Regulasi Jasa Pengiriman Belanja Online"[Gambas:Video 20detik](fdl/fdl)

RI Sluggish Economic Growth, BI: There is a Trade War
Nov 7 2019, 03:31 by Achmad Dwi Afriyadi


Photo: Achmad Dwi Afriyadi

Jakarta - Bank Indonesia (BI) revealed the condition of the national economy in the Workshop on Accelerating Infrastructure Development which was held in the Central Jakarta Region, Thursday (11/07/2019). The event was attended by representatives of local governments. Deputy Governor of BI Rosmaya Hadi explained, the current global economic conditions are uncertain and will continue. That is caused by a trade war between the United States (US) and China. "We both know the current conditions, we realize that there is a global trade war that feels roll and sustain, between America and China that penetrated Europe, Japan, and so on. And, the geopolitical conditions that have affected the economies of various countries were affected, "he said. Rosmaya continued, national economic growth data had also been released where in the third quarter the Indonesian economy only grew 5.02%. This shows that global uncertainty affected trade performance. Indeed, Rosmaya saw developments on the export side due to the increase in nickel prices. According to him, it is only temporary. "We both know exports in the third quarter have a growth in nickel exports, in particular we see the price of nickel we see there is an increase, this is not because of real needs. I think this is anticipating a ban on exports. We must be aware of "The other challenging thing is weak manufacturing performance in the midst of the transformation being carried out by the government. He said this should be a concern because it has an impact on investment and consumption. "We also see the weak performance of the manufacturing sector amid a number of government transformations and will be of our concern because of the impact of investment and consumption," he explained.
